definition: to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: The paper will appear in the journal's Online Early Edition this week.
sentences.chinese: 报告会在这周本期刊的在线早报上出现。

sentences.english: I believe it will stand the test of time.
sentences.chinese: 我相信这份报告会经得起时间考验。

sentences.english: The lecture was given under the auspices of the Academy of Sciences.
sentences.chinese: 这次报告会是由科学院主办的。

sentences.english: Could these reports be wrong?- No.
The report meeting was absorbing right from the beginning.
sentences.chinese: 这次的报告会才一开题就吸引了听众们。

sentences.english: They were the symbol of the symposium. Before the symposium, the floor of the hall had been swept.
sentences.chinese: 在专题报告会之前，大厅的地板已经被打扫过了。

sentences.english: The lecture was emceed by Chen Gang, chairman of MSTC.
sentences.chinese: 报告会由微软俱乐部主席陈刚主持。

sentences.english: This section of the component report analyses strings for common content.
sentences.chinese: 这部分的组件报告会分析常见内容的字符串。

sentences.english: Their reports will make a difference in planning our research portfolio.
sentences.chinese: 他们的报告会使我们的研究计划有所不同。

sentences.english: The report will take us a long way towards that goal.
sentences.chinese: 这份报告会一直引领我们迈向这个目标。

sentences.english: A medical symposium would be held in a hall.
sentences.chinese: 一场医学专题报告会在一个大厅里举行。

sentences.english: The reports are concatenated for displaying current information.
sentences.chinese: 这些报告会合并在一起，显示当前信息。

sentences.english: In this case, status would be reported to the syslog.
sentences.chinese: 在后台执行的情况下，状态报告会发送到系统日志。

sentences.english: They reported their findings at a recent meeting in Greece.
sentences.chinese: 最近他们在希腊的报告会上将其发现告之于众。

sentences.english: Our reports will take you inside some of the nation's colleges and universities.
sentences.chinese: 我们的报告会让你们了解一些这个国家的大学和学院。

definition: to have an informal discussion/CL:次[ci4],個|个[ge4]
to convene (a conference or meeting)/to convoke/to call together
